sentences.english: Besides copyright, the writer got a 10-percent royalty on sales.
sentences.chinese: 除擁有版權外，作者得到百分之十的版稅。
一些站點提供免版稅的圖像。

sentences.english: No royalties, no inches, nothing to do with your attractiveness.
sentences.chinese: 無關版稅，尺寸，和你的個人魅力也沒有關係。

sentences.english: Some require royalties for commercial use.
sentences.chinese: 一些剪貼畫需要商業使用版稅。

sentences.english: The technology transfer fee shall be paid in royalties.
sentences.chinese: 技術移交費應以版稅方式支付。

sentences.english: Additionally, you can share your royalties with selected reviewers who have provided you with helpful feedback.
sentences.chinese: 另外，你可以選擇給過你有用反饋的評論者分享版稅。

sentences.english: These specifications are published under royalty-free terms.
sentences.chinese: 這些規範是遵照免版稅條款發佈的。

sentences.english: We advanced her $2,000 against future royalties.
sentences.chinese: 我們預支給她2000美元版稅。

sentences.english: The details of the royalty arrangements were not publicized.
sentences.chinese: 關於版稅的具體細節目前還沒有公佈。

definition: to save on food and clothing (idiom); to live frugally
variant of 獨角戲|独角戏[du2 jiao3 xi4]
supplementary cash reserve/private fund/private hoard/slush fund
lit. to cross five passes and slay six generals (idiom)/fig. to surmount all difficulties (on the way to success)
pinyin: guo4 wu3 guan1 zhan3 liu4 jiang4
